intro: Erucastrum virgatum var. elatum, commonly known as the tall bladderpod, is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant produces pods that contain several seeds, which are often dispersed by wind. Native to North America, it thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in prairies and open woodlands. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and habitat restoration.
